Articles.Content:
its kinda hard to launch, it needs some work and i think the parts might be a tad to big, but their really awsome and would be awsome with .14!

Thanks for the feedback. Could you go into more detail about why they were hard to launch?

Making them 0.0001 drag will help make it easier to launch. Also 3 mass seems kinda high. Until persistence or space station support I think modifying them a little unrealistically will help with usefulness.
Excellent start. This looks very promising.
Aren\'t these way too big? It would be nice to use them with stock parts.
I find that even trying to launch a decently sized space station with CHEAT parts is very hard, as most of the time it just explodes from too much weight.

I find that even trying to launch a decently sized space station with CHEAT parts is very hard, as most of the time it just explodes from too much weight.

I\'ve since fixed that. The parts weigh about 1/2 of what they used to. I\'ll also strengthen the attachment points. I\'ll upload the revision later.

In other news, I made a service module which will soon have an accompanying engine, used for boosting the orbit. Those round pointy things on the side will be for refueling, if it gets added.

(see image below)
But once again... why SO huge?
It\'s only 2 meters. How is that big?

But once again... why SO huge?

1m space station parts are small.

0.0.2 is out. Download links are in the OP.

I reduced the weight of all parts. They are still a little wobbly though. I also added a service module and engine for it.

See changelog for full revision information.

0.0.2 is out. Download links are in the OP.

Now that is a very good engine for the station. It\'s not really in the way, and it looks fantastic.
Oh! THAT looks cool. It is definitely useful an pretty cool. It looks so beatiful in the space!

You are the God of ksp: Big solar panels!!

Question: Why you remove the docking port?

You are the God of ksp: Big solar panels!!

Question: Why you remove the docking port?

The docking cap should be in the .rar and .zip downloads. I didn\'t remove it at all.

Just to let everybody know, I\'m currently working on modelling more detail into some of the parts. I don\'t know when I will have anything to show though.
The new parts and values make this pack so useful!

Can you put a parts list and corresponding pictures in the OP, in spoilers or something? It\'d be nice to know what\'s included in this pack without having to fish around in the VAB to see what\'s what.

Can you put a parts list and corresponding pictures in the OP, in spoilers or something? It\'d be nice to know what\'s included in this pack without having to fish around in the VAB to see what\'s what.

Sure, I\'ll get right on that.

Edit:

Done.

Sorry for the lack of updates recently. I was caught up in the Creation Kit. I\'ve been working on modelling some detail into the module parts, making new parts such as the airlock module below, and totally remodelling others. I also want to start working on textures soon. Some quick media:
Your mod is starting to get into a realy nice shape. I like those extra details. I can\'t wait for the textures. Keep up the good work!
this starts to look jsut great can`t wait till it finished

Quick release for persistence. I\'ve been busy with school, Skyrim, and modelling a pack of rocket parts. I would have liked to do some more for this update but I feel I should get this stuff out now.

For this update, I modeled some detail into the 2x3 module, made an airlock module, and remodeled the solar array. The array was bugging me ever since I made it because it looked too simple, so I went in and remodeled it. I\'m quite happy with the result but I may modify it a little bit in the future.

Download links in OP are updated.
YES this will be perfect for my death sta.... mean space research station
This need a giant bump
Images now in OP aswell.
You did a great job on this, keep it up
